etymologies: mid 17th century: from late Latin sexualis, from Latin sexus ‘sex’

definitions: relating to the instincts, physiological processes, and activities connected with physical attraction or intimate physical contact between individuals

examples.text: she had felt the thrill of a sexual attraction

shortDefinitions: relating to instincts, physiological processes, and activities connected with physical attraction

definitions: relating to the two sexes or to gender
shortDefinitions: relating to two sexes or to gender

definitions: of or characteristic of one sex or the other

examples.text: the hormones which control the secondary sexual characteristics

shortDefinitions: of or characteristic of one sex or other

definitions: being of one sex or the other; capable of sexual reproduction

examples.text: the asexual winged forms lay the eggs which hatch into the sexual form

shortDefinitions: being of one sex or other

definitions: (of reproduction) involving the fusion of gametes.
